span.i18n:text: A corpus of selected Damokrines (Δαμοκρίνης) inscriptions

div.p: Welcome to a digital edition of a selected syllogae of Ancient Greek inscriptions, referred to Rhodian Damocrines as well as to other people: an effort of disambiguation of the connections between the island of Rhodes and other Greek islands with the regions of Asia Minor in antiquity.

There is only one inscription from the place of Aphrodisias (Asia Minor) that was found there and is displayed on the current syllogae. For more information , please click below on the
(Inscriptions) section.

There are six inscriptions of this syllogae found in Greece; the findspot of four of them is the island of Rhodes and the location of the two of them is the island of Thera, both at Aegean sea. However, they are all still accessible through the (Inscriptions) facet.
